thread.title: First day of discounted bus travel for young people in Wales |
thread.title_full: First day of discounted bus travel for young people in Wales | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: First day of discounted bus travel for young people in Wales |
text:
Young people in Wales will be able to make use of Wales' new discount bus travel scheme for the first time today.
First Minister Carwyn Jones initially launched the scheme in July this year, when young people were allowed to register their interest in the passes. Credit: Welsh Government The pass allows those aged 16 - 18 to get a third off bus fares and is open to all 110,000 residents across Wales.
Minister for Transport, Edwina Hart will mark the first day of the £15million mytravelpass discounted bus scheme by handing out the first passes at Swansea Bus Station.
I want to ensure young people are able to access jobs and training opportunities in Wales as easily as possible.
Travelling costs can sometimes be a barrier, so this scheme will make it easier and cheaper for 16-18 year olds to travel.
It underlines our commitment to supporting our young people into work and education opportunities.
– Edwina Hart, Minister for Transport Any 16-18 year old resident in Wales can now apply for their pass online.
Last updated Tue 1 Sep 2015 Travel Wales Swansea
